column4: I am running Ubuntu 8.04, on a Laptop. Have a wireless card (linksys 802.11g) that always worked before with previous versions of Ubuntu, the OS sees the card, see my network..but cant connect to it...any ideas whats wrong?
what chipset
im not sure to be honest...
this is internal pci or external usb
what does lspci in terminal say about that card (just the one line here)
that the line you're looking for?
what does ifconfig show; two entries or three
then it just says 0 packets for everythig after that
and what does sudo dhclient wlan0 return (dont paste here; in paste.ubuntu.com)
pasted
url?
sudo dhclient wlan0 (dont forget sudo)
paste.ubuntu.com/27282
is the essid on the router hidden? encrypted? if encrypted with what protocol?
so right now, it broadcasts my Network name, and is an open network..
any ideas?
let me get you a cli link
ok
ok, i will try that..
the first command that tells me to do :sudo ifconfig <interface> down, returns a bash error, saying that no such file or directory exists...
first need to associate that card with the essid; the commands are given in that link
didnt work..
